cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and eastern Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and approach the U.S. Gulf Coast mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguin, Guantanamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (incl. Vieques & Culebra), U.S. Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of Dominican Republic, northern Haiti coast, SE Bahamas, Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Caribbean from Leeward Islands through Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, then Hispaniola and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph sustained, gusts up to 60 mph) affected St. Croix early Saturday as Laura’s center passed just to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected beyond rough surf and high seas along exposed coasts.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–6 inches, locally up to 8 inches, capable of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible mudslides on steep terrain.
